# bookmarkr

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of bookmarkr is provide links of R books.

## Installation

You can install the development version of bookmarkr from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("edgar-treischl/bookmarkr")
```

```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)

#df <- readxl::read_excel(here::here("books.xlsx"))

```

```{r setup, eval=T, error=TRUE}
#Get links via: 
rbooks::show_link("keyword")
```


```{r}
head(rbooks::links())
```

```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)

df <- readxl::read_excel("books.xlsx")

```




```{r, results='asis', echo=FALSE}
df <- df |> dplyr::arrange(title)

headers <- paste0("<h2>", df$title, " (by ", df$author, ")", "</h2>", "<a href='", df$link, "'target='_blank'><img align='right' src='", df$pic, "' width='150' height='200'></a>")
desc <- paste0("<p>", df$description, "</p>")
#pics <- paste0()
output <- stringr::str_c(headers, desc)
cat(output)
```
